newsitem.title: USA: Fed adds reserves via overnight system repurchases.
newsitem.headline: Fed adds reserves via overnight system repurchases.

text.p: The Federal Reserve added temporary reserves to the banking system on Monday through overnight system repurchase agreements, a Fed spokeswoman confirmed.
Analysts had expected the Fed to add reserves either through three-day system repurchase agreements or overnight system repurchases.
At 1130 EDT/1530 GMT, Fed funds were trading at 5-1/2 percent, above the Fed's 5-1/4 percent target for the rate.
